channel.title: Way to many trolls
channel.description: Whats up with people coming on here to bug people. Can we implement more security? The idea here is that if there is more of a hassle required to join less will join to troll. Any ideas to stop these people?

item.title: Way to many trolls

item.description:
does the title of the thread hasn’t the meaning of “way to ‘dispose of’ many trolls” or something similar?

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
yes but I still rage when people state opinion as fact. it shall be punished!

I tick people off by saying “yes thats what YOU think”.

also personal attacks. thanks Burbinator! thats what YOU think (that I’m a moron).

PS you rage you lose.

ps2 I hate when people write “loose” when they mean “lose”. There is a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls

item.description:
pro-tip saivert, this is the internet and the internet != real life

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Or you can stop being a moron and realize that most people talk subjectively in most situations and not assume that everything they say is meant as fact.

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
I didn’t notice the misspelling either because I just read it as right (pronounced “to” as “too”). Guess I’m a moron then. FLAME ON!

Also I like some of the trolling here a lot, but not everything.

And another thing. I was arguing with a guy and was opposing that he stated his opinion as fact, like writing “That is just stupid” instead of writing “I think that is stupid”. Just typing out “I think” or “I feel” or “My thought” can make all the difference. Most of what people say is opinion anyways. A fact can’t be argued. It’s why we call some things fact instead of opinion. It’s why there is a difference in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: ijgs
item.description:
Dillxn:

I’m starting to think I’m the only one that really just didn’t notice it.

I refer the honorable gentleman to the following:

Dillxn:

Yes, exactly. Anyone who doesn’t see that is mentally impaired.

Ryλn:

That’s pretty harsh. mentally impaired?

ijgs:

Yes, you’re right… it is a bit strong… how’s this:

Anyone who doesn’t see that is clearly possessed of all the observation and critical thinking skills of boiled shit and it’s a wonder how they manage to type and breathe at the same time…

item.description:
Raminator:

I was going to say “no, we all noticed it but decided it wasn’t worth pointing out”, but then I read all of the posts after yours.

You guys suck.

Mine was suppose to be sarcastic. The posts after mine is what made me /facepalm.

:facepalm:

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

Am I the only one who finds the typo in the topic to be utterly hilarious?

Instead of saying “Way too many trolls” which means “the number of trolls are of a greater number than is desired or acceptable”

it says “Way to many trolls” which means “The direction that leads to a large quantity of trolls”

It almost comes across as ironic.

Haha, I didn’t even notice that. That’s eerily awesome

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: Shinyjam
item.description:
The two work cited link to that quote just gave a short definition and the second one with full page of explanation still didn’t seem too trustworthy to me.

I still don’t like people associate off topic as troll. Sure the off topic come with troll but being off topic alone should not be consider troll. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
In waltzes the gal that brings here wiki article:

Troll (Internet)
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

“Do not feed the trolls” and its abbreviation DNFTT redirect here. For the Wikimedia essay, see “What is a troll?”.

In Internet slang, a troll is someone who posts controversial, inflammatory, irrelevant, or off-topic messages in an online community, such as an online discussion forum, chat room or blog, with the primary intent of provoking other users into an emotional response[1] or of otherwise disrupting normal on-topic discussion.[2]

Ya’ll SHOULD have a read of that page tho, cuz the “history” is actually quite interesting. Only cuz I have done it myself enough times and I never realized that I could have been considered trolling.

Read full topic

item.title: Way to many trolls
item.dc:creator: Shinyjam
item.description:
Seem like most people badly confuse troll with off-topic poster.

NO! IS NOT THE SAME!:fffuuu:

Read full topic
